title: Subtasks Queue
description: Schema for subtasks.json - the work queue for Ralph Iterations (autonomous agent sessions)

$schema.description: Reference to this schema for validation

metadata.description: Optional metadata about this subtasks queue

scope.description: Whether this queue covers a milestone or single story

storyRef.description: Reference to parent story using filename format (e.g., '001-parallel-code-review'). Required when scope is 'story'.

subtasks.description: The queue of subtasks for autonomous agents to process

taskRef.description: Reference to parent task using filename format (e.g., '015-cli-ergonomics-fixes'). Null for orphan subtasks.

storyRef.description: Reference to grandparent story using filename format (e.g., '001-parallel-code-review'). Null for orphan tasks.

title.description: Short descriptive title for commit messages and progress tracking

description.description: Detailed description of what needs to be implemented

done.description: Whether the subtask has been completed. Agent sets to true after successful implementation and commit.

acceptanceCriteria.description: Plain English descriptions of how to verify the subtask is complete. Used in Validate phase.

filesToRead.description: Files and docs to read before implementing. Can include doc paths (@context/...), code files (src/...), or glob patterns (src/**/*.ts).

commitHash.description: Git commit hash that completed this subtask

commitMessage.description: Git commit message - helps calibration trace intent

sessionId.description: Claude Code session ID that completed this subtask. Maps to ~/.claude/projects/<path>/<session-id>.jsonl

knowledgeCertainty.description: Knowledge certainty level: known-known (clear what and how), known-unknown (clear what, unclear how), unknown-unknown (unclear what)

spikeIndicators.description: Count of spike indicators suggesting need for research/exploration

changeCount.description: Estimated number of discrete changes (files, functions, config entries). Used for sizing: <2 = undersized, >8 = oversized

reasoning.description: Brief explanation of the classification decision
